data: In this guide, we'll look at how to use the FormFooter component from the react-to-ui library. This component is designed to help you create a consistent footer section for your forms, typically used for action buttons like "Submit" or "Cancel".

The TextField component is a versatile input field that can be used for both single-line (input) and multi-line (textarea) text entry. It provides built-in support for labels, placeholders, suffixes, and more, making it suitable for a wide range of form use cases.
data.usage#Usage: To use the TextField component, import it and configure its props to suit your form's needs. You can use it for both single-line text inputs and multi-line text areas.

data: The FormCard component is a reusable form wrapper that provides a styled container for form elements. It simplifies form creation by handling the onSubmit event and allowing you to pass custom content as children.
data.usage#Usage: To use the FormCard component, import it and wrap your form elements inside it. You can optionally pass an onSubmit handler and additional CSS classes via the className prop.

data.installation#Installation:
Install the required dependencies using one of the following commands:
pnpm install react-ui
npm install react-ui
yarn add react-ui
burn add react-ui
data.import-css#Import CSS:
After installing the package, you'll need to import the CSS file to ensure the components are properly styled.Add the following import statement to your main CSS file, or directly in your index.js or App.js file:
import "react-to-ui/dist/index.css";
The documentation now not only explains how to use the components but also gives the user a better
understanding of the value react-ui brings to their project. This makes the documentation more informative
and encourages adoption.

data: The FormGroup component is designed to group form elements, often pairing a label or title with its corresponding input field or set of fields. This component provides a consistent layout and styling for forms, making it easier to maintain a uniform design throughout your application.
data.usage#Usage: To use the FormGroup component, simply wrap your form elements inside it, optionally providing a title prop to act as a label or descriptor for the group.
